headline: Zevia Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results; Appoints Lead Independent Director, Andrew Ruben, to Chair of the Board
summary: LOS ANGELES, February 25, 2026--Zevia PBC ("Zevia" or the "Company") (NYSE: ZVIA), the Company bringing naturally delicious, zero sugar, clean-label beverages, today reported results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year ended December 31, 2025.

headline: Retirees Take Note: The Consumer Staples ETF Hiding Some of the Market’s Strongest Dividend Growers
summary: Consumer staples stocks generate reliable income, hold up during downturns, and tend to raise dividends even when growth slows. The iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (NYSEARCA:KXI) packages that defensive logic into a single fund, holding 100+ global consumer staples companies with a 0.39% expense ratio and a 2.27% dividend yield. The fund has returned 13.57% ... Retirees Take Note: The Consumer Staples ETF Hiding Some of the Market’s Strongest Dividend Growers

headline: Moderately bullish activity in Wal-Mart with shares up 1.15%
summary: Moderately bullish activity in Wal-Mart (WMT), with shares up $1.45, or 1.15%, near $127.25. Options volume relatively light with 32k contracts traded and calls leading puts for a put/call ratio of 0.43, compared to a typical level near 1.06. Implied volatility (IV30) is higher by 0.1 points near 27.22,and above the 52wk median, suggesting an expected daily move of $2.18. Put-call skew steepened, indicating increased demand for downside protection, following a downgrade to Hold at HSBC.Claim 50%

headline: Consumer Staples Are Up Almost 20% While the S&P 500 Struggles. Retirees Are Paying Attention.

headline: Strong Earnings Not Enough to Power Stocks Past AI, Credit Worry
summary: Companies in the S&P 500 grew earnings by 13% in the fourth quarter, almost six percentage points better than expected.  The number of firms in the Russell 3000 Index that raised guidance outstripped those cutting it by four to one — a level last seen in the aftermath of recessions or after the 2018 tax reform, according to Jefferies Financial Group Inc. data.

headline: Kroger’s New CEO Brings Walmart Experience To Cost Focus And Margins
summary: Kroger appointed former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new CEO as part of a cost-cutting and restructuring plan. The leadership change follows the prior CEO’s exit over an ethics violation. The company is pursuing operational streamlining and a refocus of the business at a time of industry pressure. Kroger, listed as NYSE:KR, enters this leadership transition with shares at $69.76. The stock shows longer term resilience, with a 72.8% return over 3 years and 138.3% over 5 years, while...

headline: Saputo USA Recalls Great Value Cottage Cheese Because of Possible Health Risk
summary: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 24, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Saputo Cheese USA Inc. (SUSA or Saputo) is voluntarily recalling select cottage cheese products produced by SUSA due to the possibility of liquid dairy ingredients used in the items not being fully pasteurized according to state regulatory standards. While no illnesses or hospitalizations associated with the recalled products have been reported to date, consuming products that are not fully pasteurized can pose a significant health risk, especially to
